original_data.question: An investigator is studying the function of different enzymes in various human cell types. A subset of normal human cells with an elevated intracellular concentration of bisphosphoglycerate mutase is harvested and isolated. Which of the following is most likely to be absent in these cells?

model_response:
The answer is B. Pyruvate kinase. Pyruvate kinase is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of phosphoenolpyruvate to pyruvate. It is not known to be associated with the function of bisphosphoglycerate mutase. The other enzymes listed are known to be associated with the production and utilization of ATP.

###Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Used with organs, tissues, and cells of unicellular and multicellular organisms for normal function. It is used also with biochemical substances, endogenously produced, for their physiologic role.

Biological molecules that possess catalytic activity. They may occur naturally or be synthetically created. Enzymes are usually proteins, however CATALYTIC RNA and CATALYTIC DNA molecules have also been identified.
Members of the species Homo sapiens.
The fundamental, structural, and functional units or subunits of living organisms. They are composed of CYTOPLASM containing various ORGANELLES and a CELL MEMBRANE boundary.

The organized colloidal complex of organic and inorganic substances (as proteins and water) that constitutes the living nucleus, cytoplasm, plastids, and mitochondria of the cell. It is composed mainly of nucleic acids, proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, and inorganic salts.
The act or process of concentrating, focusing the attention and mental energy on a single object to the exclusion of others.
An enzyme that catalyzes the transfer of phosphate from C-3 of 1,3-diphosphoglycerate to C-2 of 3-phosphoglycerate, forming 2,3-diphosphoglycerate. EC 5.4.2.4.
Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.
A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.
Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
The fundamental, structural, and functional units or subunits of living organisms. They are composed of CYTOPLASM containing various ORGANELLES and a CELL MEMBRANE boundary.
